course.subject: OCES
course.name: Descriptive Physical Oceanography
course.description: This course is an introduction to physical oceanography that includes topics such as physical description of the sea, physical properties of seawater, methods and measurements, wind-driven ocean circulation, abyssal ocean circulation, boundary processes, and wave motions. Large-scale distributions and processes that are central to the ocean’s role in Earth’s climate and biosphere will also be addressed and discussed.
course.prerequisites: (PHYS 1111 OR PHYS 1112 OR PHYS 1312) AND (MATH 1012 OR MATH 1013 OR MATH 1020 OR MATH 1023)

reviews.author: from OST
reviews.title: It is required so sad
reviews.comment_content:
L01 General introduction
(W&F Ch.1 + 2; Talley Ch.1 + 14)
L02 Descriptive overview: broad terminology and oceans
(Knauss Ch.1 + 7; Talley Ch.2, 9–13; Wunsch Ch.3; P&E Ch.2 + 7)
L03 Descriptive overview: not oceans
(Knauss Ch.11; Talley Ch.2; P&E Ch.8)
L04 Forces, equations and calculus
(Knauss Ch.4 + 5; Talley Ch.7; Wunsch Ch.11; W&F Ch.3 + 4)
*** assignment 1 (1 week to do) ***
L05 Sea water properties and thermodynamic forcing I: temperature and salinity
(Knauss Ch.1, 2, 3, 8; Talley Ch.3, 4, 5; Wunsch Ch.3; W&F Ch.2; P&E Ch.3, 4, 5, 6.5)
L06 Sea water properties and thermodynamic forcing II: density
(Knauss Ch.2; Talley Ch.3, 4, 5; Wunsch Ch.3; W&F Ch.2, 3, 4; P&E Ch.3)
L07 Mechanical forcing I: pressure + gravity
(Knauss Ch.5; Talley Ch.7; Wunsch Ch.3; W&F Ch.3 + 4)
L08 Mechanical forcing II: rotation (Coriolis)
(Wunsch Ch.3; Talley Ch.7; Knauss Ch. 5 + 6; W&F Ch.3 + 4)
*** assignment 2 (1 week to do) ***
L09 Mechanical forcing III: wind
(Wunsch Ch.3; Knauss Ch.6; Talley Ch.7; W&F Ch.3 + 4; P&E Ch.7.1)
L10 Mechanical forcing IV: friction and viscosity
(Wunsch Ch.11; Knauss Ch.4; Talley Ch.7; W&F Ch.3 + 4)
L11 Wind driven circulation I: Ekman + Sverdrup
(Wunsch Ch.3; W&F Ch.8)
L12 Wind driven circulation II: Western Boundary Currents
(Wunsch Ch.10, 11; P&E Ch.7; Talley Ch.9, 10; W&F Ch.8)
*** Mid-term (1hr) ***
L13 Meridional Overturning Circulation I: Southern Ocean and ACC
(Wunsch Ch.9, 11; Talley Ch.1; 3W&F Ch.10 + 12; E&P Ch.7.1, 7.2)
L14 Meridional Overturning Circulation II: ACC + gyres + boundary currents
(Knauss Ch.8; Wunsch Ch.9, 10, 11; Talley Ch. 9, 13, 14; W&F Ch.10 + 12; E&P Ch.7.1,
7.2)
Physical ocenaography by drawing pictures OCES 2003
L15 Dynamics I: waves
(Knauss Ch.9; Wunsch Ch.4; W&F Ch.3 + 4)
L16 Dynamics II: types of waves
(Knauss Ch.10; Wunsch Ch.5; Talley Ch.8; W&F Ch.3 + 4)
T03 Problems class for concepts so far and somewhat for assignment 3
*** assignment 3 (1 week to do) ***
L17 Dynamics III: instabilities
(Wunsch Ch.3; W&F Ch.3, 4, 9)
L18 Dynamics IV: tides
(Knauss Ch.10; Wunsch Ch.6 + 7; Talley Ch.8)
L19 Observations I: in-situ
(Knauss Ch.1; Wunsch Ch.2; Talley Ch.6; P&E Ch.6)
L20 Observations II: remote
(Knauss Ch.12; Wunsch Ch.2, 8, 9; Talley Ch.6; P&E Ch.6)
T04 Problems class for concepts so far and somewhat for assignment 4
*** assignment 4 (1 week to do) ***
G01 Observations III: guest lecture from someone who actually goes to sea
T05 Review of course + outlooks
*** Finals (∼3hrs) ***
reviews.comment_teaching:
ppt 有好多picture, drawing 幫你明concept
有時佢好投入寫好多equations 但冇人會明
同埋第一次教 ppt 會有錯處
上堂都有時講錯
有時講得好快下
可以睇返zoom recording 或者問佢
佢都會努力解答問題
明唔明就另一會事
reviews.comment_grading:
Attendance 10% 送 佢冇take過
4 Assignments 40%
Midterm 20%
Final 30%

佢成日話唔過50% 就F
但最後佢都改左 調低左cut off
"90% at the moment is the A- boundary, and below 50% is a fail."  after the midterm
"85% and above is A-, and anything below 50% is a fail" before final
但最後應該80%and above is A-

Total 82% A-
得3個A range 但好似其他都派得ok
reviews.comment_workload:
extremely large

4 Assignments
midterm
final

assignment 極難靠問TA 成日都睇唔明佢想問咩
一份要做幾日 有essay calculation drawing explanation
上網都冇咩references
要靚grade 一定要睇佢本書
同jot notes
equations 多數 唔洗識計但要知有咩factors
